title: Ohio State Route 587
text:
State Route 587 (SR 587) is a north–south <a href="state%20route">state route</a> in the northwestern quadrant of the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Ohio">Ohio</a>. The highway's southern terminus is at <a href="Ohio%20State%20Route%2053">SR 53</a> in the <a href="census-designated%20place">census-designated place</a> of <a href="McCutchenville%2C%20Ohio">McCutchenville</a> about southeast of <a href="New%20Riegel%2C%20Ohio">New Riegel</a>. Its northern terminus is at a T-intersection with <a href="Ohio%20State%20Route%2018">SR 18</a> in the southeastern corner of the <a href="city">city</a> of <a href="Fostoria%2C%20Ohio">Fostoria</a>.
Route description.
SR 587 is located in the extreme northern portion of <a href="Wyandot%20County%2C%20Ohio">Wyandot County</a> and the southwestern quadrant of <a href="Seneca%20County%2C%20Ohio">Seneca County</a>. This highway is not included as a component of the <a href="National%20Highway%20System%20%28United%20States%29">National Highway System</a>, a network of highways deemed most important for the country's economy, mobility and defense.
History.
SR 587 was designated in 1937. The highway originally consisted of today's Wyandot County Road 35 from <a href="Ohio%20State%20Route%2067">SR 67</a> approximately southwest of <a href="Sycamore%2C%20Ohio">Sycamore</a> to the intersection marking SR 587's southern terminus at SR 53 in McCutchenville and the entirety of the current SR 587. In 1965, the portion of SR 587 southeast of McCutchenville was removed from the state highway system. Jurisdiction of this stretch of roadway was transferred to Wyandot County, who then designated it as County Road 35.
